title: [JIT] Switch JIT passes to take a graph rather than TracingState
body_html:
This makes it so that we can run the passes on the Graphs held by ScriptModules, which do not hold a TracingState but rather a bare graph. This facilitates the ONNX export pass for ScriptModules

@zdevito @apaszke @ezyang I'm not sure why the expect files are changing. The only differences seem to be the unique() identifiers for each value after DCE. It seems to me like it's a difference between assigning a new Graph to the attribute on TracingState v.s. mutating the Graph directly. I can't find where that difference is in code. Any ideas?

body:
This makes it so that we can run the passes on the `Graph`s held by `ScriptModule`s, which do not hold a `TracingState` but rather a bare graph. This facilitates the ONNX export pass for `ScriptModule`s

@zdevito @apaszke @ezyang I'm not sure why the expect files are changing. The only differences seem to be the `unique()` identifiers for each value after DCE. It seems to me like it's a difference between assigning a new `Graph` to the attribute on `TracingState` v.s. mutating the `Graph` directly. I can't find where that difference is in code. Any ideas?
